newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan interbank rate ends softer, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan interbank rate ends softer, seen stable.

text.p: Taiwan's overnight interbank rate closed slightly softer on Tuesday amid loose liquidity in the banking system and dealers expected the rate to stay around current levels in the near term.

The interbank rate ended at 4.967 percent against Monday's 4.982 close, with 30-day commercial paper unchanged at 4.85-4.90. Dealers expected the interbank rate to move around 5.00 percent for Wednesday.
In the bond market, no transaction was reported in the afternoon and traders expected slow sentiment to continue in coming sessions. -- Julie Hu (5080815)
